business.headline: Swiggy CEO makes rare appearance at IPO listing, shares origin storySwiggy shares listed at a premium of 8% over issue price, beating GMP estimates on the National Stock Exchange (NSE).

Zinka Logistics Solution Limited IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe? Zinka Logistics Solution Limited IPO comprises a fresh issue of 2.01 crore shares, raising Rs 550 crore, along with an offer for sale of 2.07 crore shares, amounting to Rs 564.72 crore.

Swiggy IPO listing delivers pleasant surprise to investors. Sell now or hold?Swiggy listing: With the company's shares opening at Rs 420 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), marking a solid 7.6% premium over its issue price of Rs 390, the performance has exceeded initial expectations

NTPC Green Energy IPO: Check price band, issue size, GMP NTPC Green Energy IPO aims to raise Rs 10,000 crore, making it the third-largest IPO of the year, following Hyundai Motors India's Rs 28,756 crore IPO and Swiggy's Rs 11,327 crore public listing.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as cautious sentiment prevails in marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 76.81 points to 78,598.37, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 75 points to 23,808.45.

GIFT Nifty slips 45 points: What to expect in today's market sessionExperts mentioned that fears around Trump's potential tariff policies, especially targeting China, are weighing on emerging markets like India.

Sensex tumbles over 800 points. Here's how much money investors lostAnalysts attributed the selloff to continued foreign investor outflows and disappointing quarterly earnings, particularly in banking and auto sectors. Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) reportedly offloaded Rs 2,306 crore worth of Indian equities, extending their selling spree.

Swiggy IPO listing: Around 500 employees likely to become crorepatisSwiggy's IPO stock market listing: The grey market premium (GMP) of Rs 2 ahead of Wednesday's debut indicates only a marginal gain of 0.51% above the issue price.
Retail inflation at a 14-month high, rises to 6.21% in OctoberThe inflation rate currently stands at 6.68% in rural areas, surpassing the urban inflation rate, which is recorded at 5.62%.

Sensex tanks 820 points, Nifty tumbles: 4 factors behind stock market bloodbathAfter opening in green, the S&P BSE Sensex reversed course, dragged down by banking, financial services, and auto stocks. The Nifty50, too, faced a broad-based decline, with nearly all sectoral indices closing in the red except for Nifty Realty.

Bitcoin's comeback: Will it cross the $100,000 mark soon?Donald Trump's win has injected fresh optimism among crypto advocates, as he has previously championed a supportive regulatory framework for digital assets.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Executive can't become judge: Supreme Court warning on bulldozer actionThe top court emphasised that the executive cannot assume the role of adjudication, stating that the arbitrary demolition of a citizen's home on mere accusations violates constitutional law and the principle of separation of powers.

Uddhav Thackeray on 'ek hai toh safe hai': Meant for BJP as it wants to rule soloIn an exclusive interview with India Today, Uddhav Thackeray spoke on a range of topics, from the chief ministerial face of the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) to the row over his luggage being inspected by election officials.

Taliban name student as Afghan envoy in Mumbai, India yet to respondThe Taliban regime of Afghanistan has named Ikramuddin Kamil, who has done his PhD in international law from New Delhi's South Asia University, as the 'acting consul' to its Mumbai mission. The proposal is waiting approval from India. The Taliban move comes a week after an Indian delegation visited Kabul.

Patient's son stabs doctor 7 times in Chennai hospital, arrestedA doctor at Kalaignar Centenary Hospital in Chennai was stabbed by a man whose mother was admitted there. Chief Minister MK Stalin has ordered a detailed enquiry and assured strict action against the perpetrator.

When Vivek Ramaswamy was 18: School speech emerges as he readies for DOGE roleIn the clip shared on X, the 18-year-old Vivek Ramaswamy, with confidence on his sleeve, could be heard urging his classmates to reflect on the journey ahead.

Democrat Senator's 'efficient' dig at Elon Musk-Vivek Ramaswamy heading DOGEUS Senator Elizabeth Warren's remark came hours after Donald Trump named billionaire Elon Musk and former Republican presidential candidate Vivek Ramaswamy to lead the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) to clean up the federal bureaucracy.

Delhi's toxic air: Why you should not take your cough lightlyHigh levels of air pollution in northern India have caused health issues like persistent cough and itchy eyes among citizens. Doctors report an increase in patients with cough-like symptoms.

Not happy sight to see people dragged to street: Court sets rules on demolitionsThe Supreme Court issued guidelines for demolitions in cases of illegal construction and encroachments, mandating a 15-day advance notice, video recording, and public display of reports and warning officials of prosecution for non-compliance.
Coldplay announces new show in AhmedabadColdplay announced their new show in Ahmedabad. They are set to perform at the Narendra Modi Stadium in January, 2025.

Indians dream of life in US, but why are Americans fleeing the country?Indians even use the risky Donkey Route for a life in the US. However, Americans are choosing a life outside the US, according to reports and online discussions. AmerExit became a hot topic after Donald Trump's victory. Who are these Americans fleeing the US, and why are they doing so?

Air India mandates pre-booked meals, adds halal certified option for muslimsAs part of a major overhaul in its in-flight service, Air India now requires all passengers to pre-book meals, offering specialised options like halal-certified meals exclusively for Muslim passengers who select the 'Muslim Meal' (MOML) during booking.

Delhi gas chamber: Thick smog diverts flights, air quality drops to 'very poor'AQI in Delhi: Aya nagar, Anand Vihar and Delhi University's North Campus recorded the worst air quality in the city with air quality crossing over 400 on Wednesday, which falls under the severe category, according to the data by the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB).

Burning garbage to generate electricity. But there is a big problemDelhi's waste-to-energy incinerators have long been hailed as a complex solution to the city's mounting garbage crisis. But, they have a fatal flaw.

Devendra Fadnavis's bag was checked too: BJP rebuts Uddhav Thackeray with videoMaharashtra Election: The BJP shared a video on X, showing Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis's bags being checked. This comes after a row over two bag checks of Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray, once in Yavatmal and another time in Latur.

Kannada actor Shiva Rajkumar hints at joining Vijay in last film, Thalapathy 69Kannada actor Shiva Rajkumar, who is gearing up for the release of his film Bhairathi Ranagal, revealed in an interview that he has been offered a role in Vijay's last film, Thalapathy 69.

Yeh Kaali Kaali Ankhein 2: Gurmeet Choudhary joins Tahir Raj Bhasin's deadly gameThe trailer for Yeh Kaali Kaali Ankhein Season 2, featuring Tahir Raj Bhasin, Anchal Singh, and Shweta Tripathi, has been released. Vidya Balan, Sonu Nigam vibe with young beatboxer, videos go viral In a couple of videos that are going viral on social media, Sonu Nigam and Vidya Balan can be seen jamming with a young beatboxer. Australia's coach Daniel Vettori likely to miss Perth Test to attend IPL auctionAustralia's assistant coach Daniel Vettori is likey to miss the first Test of the series against India in Perth to attend IPL 2025 auction for Sunrisers Hyderabad.

This remarkable innings featured 33 fours and 9 sixes.

Virat and I have talked about it few times: Rahul recalls IPL 2016 finalKL Rahul talked about RCB's heartbreaking defeat in the final of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2016 where Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH), led by David Warner, came up trumps. RCB failed to chase down a target of 209 despite fifties from Chris Gayle and Virat Kohli.

Ricky Ponting hits back at 'prickly' Gautam Gambhir, defends take on Virat KohliRicky Ponting has clarified his recent comments about Virat Kohli and claimed that he wasn't trying to take a jibe at the Indian star batter. Magnus Carlsen meets 3-year-old prodigy Anish Sarkar: 'Amazing to see his level'Legendary Magnus Carlsen praised three-year-old Anish Sarkar, who became the youngest-rated player in the history of chess. Carlsen had a piece of advice for the toddler, who has taken the world by storm with his love for the sport.

Lyon is a more complete bowler than Ashwin: Former South Africa spinner AUS vs IND: Former South Africa spinner Paul Adams said that Nathan Lyon is a more complete bowler than Ravi Ashwin. Both Ashwin and Lyon will go head-to-head in the upcoming Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

Rohit, Virat would have loved to play warm-up games: ManjrekarFormer India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar believes that Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli would have loved to play warm-up games in Australia. Manjrekar says that with the kind of form and confidence India are going into the tour, they probably needed the matches to get into groove.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
